descriptionMarkdown:
The problems this circuit is meant to solve

- Maintaining levels of items in the destination, determined by the combinator
- Ensuring only the exact amount requested gets added
- Ensuring the chests don't get filled up because of logistic bots over-supplying


This circuit requires the following ([] acts as a label):

- A source [SC] (assumes requester chest)
- A buffer [BU] (assumes a steel chest)
- A destination [DE] (needs to be able to read contents)
- A void [VO] (assumes active provider chest)
- A combinator [CM] with desired items
- A filter inserter to move from BU to DE [F1] (assumes a stack filter inserter)
- A filter inserter to move from BU to VO [F2] (assumes a stack filter inserter)

The right side of the circuit handles moving items from SC to BU. It also handles setting the filters and stack size for F1
The left side of the circuit handles moving items from BU to VO. It also handles setting the filters and stack size for F2

Both F1 and F2 need to be configured to have a Mode of operation be "Set filters" with "Set stack size" checked. The control signal should be Signal S

In order to get these to work, you need to do the following red wiring:

- From DE to the input of the right top row * combinator
- From BU to the input of the right top row * combinator
- From the output of the left top row far left < combinator to F2
- From the output of the left top row != combinator to SC
- From the output of the right bottom row far right > combinator to F1

And the following green wiring:

- From DE to the input of right bottom row * combinator
- From CM to the input of the right top row != combinator
- From CM to the input of the right bottom row far left > combinator
- From the output of the left top row far left < combinator to F2
- From the output of the right bottom row second to far right > combinator to F1
title: Precise Filter Insertion
